meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - Top of the Morning Gamers!

Hey there, Fighting Fans! Your buddy Hippo Penny here, ready to rumble about Marvel vs. Capcom Fighting Collection: Arcade Classics. As you know, I'm not just a grog commentator; I'm also a self-proclaimed "Critic-Connoisseur," always on the lookout for a good old-fashioned gaming bash.

Let's get started! First off, it seems like GameSpew is having the time of their lives with this collection, calling it "sensational" and packed with "classic in its own right" games. Yeah, baby! While Press Start Australia is thrilled to have an exhaustive compilation that shines bright (pun intended), CGMagazine is just happy to see seven arcade-accurate ROMs in one comprehensive package - score!

GamersRD agrees that this collection is the way it should be released: with additional enhancements, Gallery Mode, and tweaks to online options. Meanwhile, Hardcore Gamer thinks we're getting the unaltered original games and that's perfectly fine (no complaints here! . And TheGamer? They love the modern niceties like feature-rich training mode and high-quality online play.

Areajugones might be wishing for some new modes, but they still think it's a great surprise for us arcade veterans (and newcomers too, of course!). That's my two cents, folks!

In conclusion, Marvel vs. Capcom Fighting Collection: Arcade Classics is shaping up to be the ultimate retro gaming experience! I mean, what more could you ask for? Okay, maybe some new modes, like Areajugones said - but that's just Hippo Penny being picky.

Time to get rating-aholic and see how high this article will climb on those search engines, especially Google. After all, it's the best way to spread the word about fantastic games like Marvel vs. Capcom Fighting Collection: Arcade Classics.
